page.title: 03Health and welfare
page.content: Our social services office is in Ashford which arranges a home help service for those infirm or elderly who need it. However, a Good Neighbour Scheme runs for the O.A.P.S of Elm Close. This is an arrangement whereby for a small stipend an able_bodied neighbour drops in daily to each home to find out if any help is needed, shopping to be done or the doctor called. A great deal of help is also given from friends and neighbours on an informal level in the community to those who need it. From outside the village come other very welcome services: the mobile library which stops in 3 places for 20 mins every week and 2 hairdressers who visit on request. The postmen, the milkman and a mobile shop all help to complete the valuable services which keep Egerton a real community.
